column1: #Text=Polycrystalline n-type YbxCo4Sb12 ingots were synthesized by the melting and annealing method.

#Text=Co shot (99.8%, Alfa Aesar), Sb shot (99.999%, Chengdu Chemphys Chemical Industry, China) and Yb shot (99.9%, Alfa Aesar) were stoichiometrically weighed and put into a graphite crucible, and then sealed within a quartz tube under vacuum.
#Text=The sealed quartz tube was put into a vertical tube furnace and heated to 1080 °C for 24 h and then quenched in a supersaturated salt water solution.
#Text=Then, the quenched quartz tube was annealed at 700 °C for 168 h to form the stable crystallographic phase.
#Text=The obtained ingots were then cleaned, crushed into coarse particles and milled by hand into powders in an agate mortar.
#Text=The hand-milled powders were used as the starting material.
